intro: Lennea robinioides, commonly known as the silky forest tree, is a tropical evergreen shrub or small tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its smooth, greyish bark and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in cymes, followed by small, round berries. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
